posts.post_content:
i bought the precon deck becuase of this card. it looked cool foil and it's not a terrible creature. I don't think this guy is that good in a Kaalia deck, unless the build centers around angels and humans. This set has me so confused about Kaalia now! I don't know if I want her to center around demons/angels/humans, or demons/humans, or angels/humans, dragons can go screw at this point.
  
   
I have a [ghave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ghave) edh that uses things like [doubling season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doubling season) and [increasing savagery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=increasing savagery). It's mostly a token build of course, but something like this will benefit if [doubling season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doubling season) is in play.
  
   
--"I'll announce my attack with the herald"
  
   
--immediately put 2 counters on it (assuming it's not killed during the declare attackers step)...oh my I have a doubling season in play, 5/5 flier!

posts.post_content:
It's like Anima, needs only one color but also lacks protection. Most human cards are cheap enough to be casted, the main benefit is the reduction of cost for angels. Then again, you need to attack with her several times to make the effect worthwhile unlike Anima could just pump up via 1cc creatures. By the time it happens, I'd question if this angel is worth the deck slot.  
  
Then again, Herald is not a legend, which means you can have several in play and all provide some cost reduction. Defy Death will speed it up also, same color too.

Posted By: Cyberium (4/26/2012 11:42:58 PM)
Rating:

Combos with Ring of Thune. This card is so raunchy. I mean, it's not Baneslayer Angel but, it can become just as large of a threat when you have tons of card draw. With this guy you can cantrip your whole hand or more every turn with the help of Mentor of the Meek. Works well with exalted. Also, apparently works really well with Mikaeus, The Lunarch who would have guessed that it just so happens I have him in my deck anyways. Cavern of souls anyone?

@AMart83 If you don't like him, you built your deck wrong. This card is a bomb in limited and a great card in constructed. It's not Baneslayer Angel but, that card is pretty broken. This is Tier 2.

For me, 4.5/5 and for all those fellow Johnny/Spike players out there.

Posted By: Ligerman30 (8/9/2012 11:51:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Rating: 2/5.  
  
After having played with this card, here's what I think:  
  
-Too expensive at ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol).  
-Too slow for ramping Angels out.  
-Too fragile (even w/ it's pump ability) because it has to attack and prone to removal or combat tricks.  
-Obv. prone to being countered/bounced.  
  
One of the following would have made this card worth keeping IMO:  
-A cost of ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol).  
-Not needing to attack to pump it up.  
-Not needing to add counters in order lower the cost of Human/Angel spells and replacing it with a static ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) less to play Human/Angel spells.  
-A 4/4 body.  
-Coming into play with a +1/+1 counter already on it.  
-Vigilance.  
-Hexproof/Shroud.  
-Indestructible.   
  
It wins very few games, and most of the time it just ends up with the player tapping out when they played it and essentially losing their turn after it was countered / removed / bounced.  
  
If you need ramping for Angels+Humans (plus other creatures), you can try splashing in [Somberwald Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Somberwald Sage). It can be had on Turn 2 or 3,... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Rating: 2/5.

After having played with this card, here's what I think:

-Too expensive at .
-Too slow for ramping Angels out.
-Too fragile (even w/ it's pump ability) because it has to attack and prone to removal or combat tricks.
-Obv. prone to being countered/bounced.

One of the following would have made this card worth keeping IMO:
-A cost of .
-Not needing to attack to pump it up.
-Not needing to add counters in order lower the cost of Human/Angel spells and replacing it with a static less to play Human/Angel spells.
-A 4/4 body.
-Coming into play with a +1/+1 counter already on it.
-Vigilance.
-Hexproof/Shroud.
-Indestructible.

It wins very few games, and most of the time it just ends up with the player tapping out when they played it and essentially losing their turn after it was countered / removed / bounced.

If you need ramping for Angels+Humans (plus other creatures), you can try splashing in Somberwald Sage. It can be had on Turn 2 or 3,... (see all)
